author: Aric Jenkins
description: Greg Gianforte was charged with misdemeanor assault
title: Reporter Claims Montana GOP House Candidate Greg Gianforte 'Body Slammed' Him

author: Analysis by Chris Cillizza, CNN Editor-at-large
description: On the eve of Montana's special House election, Republican nominee Greg Gianforte got into a physical altercation with a reporter from The Guardian newspaper -- an incredibly odd and potentially damaging last-minute swerve in a race that has, of late, attracted considerable national attention and money.
title: Greg Gianforte just made a massive error on the final night of the Montana special election

author: https://www.facebook.com/hadas.gold
description: “Get the hell out of here,” Greg Gianforte is heard yelling.
title: Reporter: Montana House GOP candidate  'body-slammed' me

author: Seaborn Larson
description: A reporter for the Guardian was allegedly assaulted by Greg Gianforte, the Republican candidate in the Montana U.S. House race, the reporter said via Twitter.
title: Montana GOP candidate cited after reporter alleged he was ‘body slammed’

description: Republican congressional candidate for Montana Greg Gianforte allegedly "body slammed" Guardian reporter Ben Jacobs, according to sources familiar with the situation.
title: Source: GOP candidate 'body slammed' reporter - CNN Video

author: Leslie Shaffer
description: A Guardian reporter said Montana Republican candidate Greg Gianforte allegedly “body slammed” him in a taped interview. The campaign disputed the description.
title: Montana Republican special-election candidate cited for assault after allegedly 'body slamming' reporter

author: Julia Carrie Wong, Sam Levin
description: Audio of Greg Gianforte attacking Ben Jacobs corroborated by Fox News journalists in the room, who described candidate ‘slamming him to the ground’
title: Republican candidate charged with assault after 'body-slamming' Guardian reporter

author: https://www.facebook.com/daveweigel?fref=ts
description: Greg Gianforte, who is seen as the slight favorite in a race that ends Thursday, left what was supposed to be a final campaign rally, without making remarks. He faces a maximum $500 fine or six months in jail.
title: GOP candidate in Montana race charged with misdemeanor assault after allegedly body-slamming reporter

description: BOZEMAN, Mont. (AP) — The Latest on assault allegations against Republican congressional candidate Greg Gianforte (all times local): 10:35 p.m. Democrats are launching Facebook ads against Republican Greg Gianforte over his alleged body-slamming of a reporter. The Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee announced the spots late Wednesday. It's an almost instant turnaround before polls close Thursday evening. The Democratic committee said it hopes to target Democrats who were otherwise unlikely to vote in the special election. The committee said it will spend "the maximum amount of money allowable" behind ads targeting the state's Democrats. The spot includes the audio recording made by reporter Ben Jacobs as Gianforte allegedly slammed him to the ground. Fox News says a crew saw Gianforte grab Jacobs by the neck and slam him to the ground. Gianforte's campaign says the two fell to the ground together while fighting over a recorder. Gallatin County Sheriff Brian Gootkin said authorities are investigating.
title: The Latest: Democrats launch ads on Montana body-slam

author: BOBBY CAINA CALVAN
description: BOZEMAN, Mont. (AP) — The Republican candidate for Montana's sole congressional seat was charged with misdemeanor assault Wednesday night after witnesses told police Greg Gianforte grabbed a reporter by the neck and slammed him to the ground the night before polls close in the nationally-watched election. Gallatin County Sheriff Brian Gootkin made the announcement late Wednesday in a statement posted to the county web site. Gianforte would face a maximum $500 fine or 6 months in jail if convicted. The statement added that the reporter's injuries did not meet the legal definition of felony assault.
title: GOP candidate charged with misdemeanor assault of reporter
